text.214_Daf, 59_Line: When his son died, “he stood and destroyed his [son’s] wedding canopy.
text.215_Daf, 65_Line: may my food be bitter like olive and given over in (by) Your hand, and may it not be sweet like honey and given over by a hand of flesh and blood.
text.214_Daf, 56_Line: Why did God destroy the animals in the flood, if it was human beings who had sinned?
text.75_Daf, 28_Line: ... Since he was spoiled [by sinning] the Holy One set His hand upon him and diminished him, for it is said, ‘and You laid Your palm upon me’.
text.214_Daf, 60_Line: He said: For nothing else did I make the canopy except for my son. Now that he has died, what [use is it] for me?
text.215_Daf, 63_Line: Said the dove before the Holy One:
text.214_Daf, 57_Line: [A teaching of R’ Yehoshua ben Qorchah]
text.214_Daf, 58_Line: [answers this question with a parable:] A man made a wedding for his son, preparing a feast.
text.214_Daf, 62_Line: For nothing else did I create the beasts and animals except for the sake of humanity. Now that humanity is sinning, what [use are they] for me?”
